law.catch_line: A claim under this subtitle shall:...

text.section:
The Treasurer may:
consider a claim for money damages under this subtitle or delegate wholly or partly this responsibility to other State personnel; and
contract for any support services that are needed to carry out this responsibility properly.

section.section: In this section, "structured settlement" means a plan for the payment of a settlement or judgment to a claimant for damages in periodic installments.

Unless a contract with a private insurer provides otherwise, the Treasurer or designee may compromise and settle a claim for money damages after the Treasurer or designee consults with the Attorney General.
The State may enter into a structured settlement to the extent permitted in § 12-104(a)(2) of this subtitle.
If a structured settlement is entered into, the State and the claimant shall select the investment company by mutual agreement.

The acceptance of a settlement by a claimant is, as to that claimant:
final; and
a complete release of each claim arising from the same cause of action against:
the State;
each of its units; and
all State personnel.

text.section:
A claim under this subtitle is denied finally:
if, by certified mail, return receipt requested, under a postmark of the United States Postal Service, the Treasurer or designee sends the claimant, or the legal representative or counsel for the claimant written notice of denial; or
if the Treasurer or designee fails to give notice of a final decision within 6 months after the filing of the claim.
